Welcome to Bernardo Trevi√±o's GitHub site


This is my GitHub page where I share some of my projects final results and repositories. Feel free to navigate through them and use things you found useful for your project.

  • Websites

    • Jeopardy

      A complete web system that implements a Jeopardy game consists in several section. First section is for making questions that you can later use in the game. The second one consists on making the game and select the questions you would like to include. The final one is actually playing the game and see the results. The purpose of this project was that a teacher can use the system for education purposes. The technologies used were, in the client side, JSP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and, in the server side, Java Servlets. This was done as part of a project for the module Web Design in the Tec de Monterrey. It was done using Netbeans.

      View the source code
    • GolfPhpProject

      A website that calculates basic Golf statistics based on one round of 18 holes. The technologies used were, in the client side, PHP, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and, in the server side, PHP. This was done as part of a project for the module Web Design in the Tec de Monterrey. It was done using PhpStorm.

      View the source code
    • ThingsToDo

      Simple website made only using client side technilogies (HTML, CSS, and JavaScript) that main purpose is to tell you what to do now from a list of things. The action you will do is chosen by a random function. Made just for fun! The content is in Spanish.

      Try it now! View the source code

  • Java Projects

    • Video Games

      • Thrust

        Simple video game based on 1986 computer game Thrust. This was done as part of a lab session for the module Physics Based Games in the University of Essex. It was done using Netbeans.

        View the source code
      • Snooker

        Simple video game that tries to implement a Snooker game. This was done as part of a lab session for the module Physics Based Games in the University of Essex. It was done using Netbeans.

        View the source code
      • BrickBreaker

        A 5 level game based on Breakout. The theme of the game is of the Breaking Bad series. This was done as part for a homework of the module Video Games Project in the Tec de Monterrey. It was done using Netbeans.

        View the source code

    • Android Apps

      • Lights On

        App that implements a Lights Out game with the variation that insted of toggling itself and the adjacent ones, the entire row and column is affected. This was done as part of a several lab session of the module Mobile and Social Application Programming in the University of Essex. It was done using IntelliJ.

        View the source code
